countrySections.content:

countrySections.title: Response on Indonesia Visa Decision and Appeal Rights if Rejected
countrySections.content:
Bangladesh to Indonesia visa decision usually takes not more than 5 to 7 working days. Once the decision is made, Indonesia Immigration will let you know the decision.

Now the most common query is what if your Indonesia visa gets rejected? You have both the opportunity to reapply or appeal against your Indonesia visa rejection. You will get a refusal letter with your eligibility to appeal or reapply. The process will also be in the letter. 

To appeal, you will need to gather the necessary supporting documents along with an appeal letter. You cannot appeal after the designated time frame. Then, submit the appeal to Indonesian Immigration. It can take several weeks or months to get your appeal decision.

You can reapply anytime for an Indonesia visa. There is also no fixed number of limits for reapplication. However, an excessive amount of visa application rejection can negatively impact your visa record. In this case, the most important thing is to find out the reason behind your visa application rejection. It will help to correct your previous mistakes and increase your chances of getting a visa.

The Armenia visa processing time for Bangladeshi typically takes 10 to 20 working days. It will vary based on the types of the Armenia visa category that is applied.

The visa fee also depends on the visa category you are applying for. You do not need to pay for the Official and Diplomatic Armenia visa. The Tourist visa fee for Armenia is BDT 880. The average Armenia visa fee for Bangladeshi citizens is between BDT 2745 to BDT 11,200. Please check the up-to-date information about visa fees before applying.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: When You Get Your Armenia Visa Decision and Approach to Appeal
countrySections.content:
Your Bangladesh to Armenia visa decision comes out within 15 to 17 working days. The decision time can vary according to the visa category that you are applying for. So, have patience and apply beforehand to avoid unavoidable complications. 

There is no process to appeal for an Armenia visa for Bangladeshi. If the visa decision comes out as rejected, you can only reapply for the Armenia visa. You will get the relevant instructions such as the timeline or process to reapply in your refusal letter. You should carefully review the grounds for the visa rejection. Then collect the required documents before reapplication. It will improve your visa profile and will enhance the chance of your visa approval.

countrySections.content:

The designated Laos consulate informs applicants about their visa refusal. The refusal letter includes what is the reason behind the visa refusal. Keeping this reason in mind, applicants should update their documents. They also might need to provide additional documents while filing an appeal.

countrySections.title: Processing Time And Fee For South Korea Visa From Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
South Korea visa fee for Bangladeshi starts with a short-term single entry visa and also has the option of multiple entry for both short and long term. South Korea’s visa fee costs between BDT 4400 to BDT 9885. The range of the fees can change at times as it depends on the international currency rate.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: South Korea Visa Decision And Appeal: Process And Details
countrySections.content:
Bangladeshi applicants can appeal against the South Korean visa rejection within 7 working days of the visa decision. The appeal has to be filed in written form in English or Korean language. Applicants can file a second appeal if the first appeal decision comes out negative. The time frame for the second appeal is also 7 days from the decision of the first appeal.

Applicants can also reapply for their South Korea visa if the previous attempt gets rejected. In this case, applicants for all visa types must wait for 6 months to resubmit their South Korea visa application from Bangladesh. The previous visa fee is also not refundable.

items.title: Step 1: Visit the Burundi Immigration portal and download the Burundi on arrival visa form for Bangladeshi. Complete the entry pass form, print it, and bring it with you while traveling to Burundi.

The People's Democratic Republic of Algeria is a State of North Africa. Algeria does not offer visa-free entry passes for Bangladeshis. So, without a valid Algeria visa, no one can get an entry to Algeria. 

Recently, the Algeria Embassy of Bangladesh has started working to process Algeria visa for Bangladeshi. The applicant’s in-person visit is mandatory for the Algeria visa application. Algeria issues visas as stickers attached to the applicant's passport.

This article has all the information about Bangladesh to Algeria visas that applicants need. This includes Algeria Visa types, application process, fees, etc.
countryPage.visaTypeSectionTitle: Visa Types for Bangladeshi Travelers to Algeria
countryPage.visaTypeSectionDescription: Knowing about visa categories helps applicants to figure out what kind of visa they need and how to apply for it. Algeria offers 3 categories of visas with lots of subcategories. Among them, the transit visa duration is a maximum of 7 days. The short-stay visas are valid for 180 days with a consecutive stay of up to 90 days. The D type or Algeria national visa refers to long-term visas where applicants can stay up to 2 years. Here is the list of the Algeria visa for Bangladeshi visa types for Bangladeshi.

items.title: Step 1: Visit the Guinea-Bissau Immigration portal and download the Guinea-Bissau on arrival visa form for Bangladeshi. Complete the entry pass form, print it, and bring it with you while traveling to Guinea-Bissau.

Step 3: Show your passport and get your entry pass seal from Bangladesh Immigration.
Step 4: Fly to Guinea-Bissau’s Airport.

Step 7: Get your sealed entry pass and enjoy your Guinea-Bissau trip.

countrySections.title: Time and fees for South Africa visa processing in Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
After submitting your documents at the Visa Application Center, short-term South Africa visa processing time takes 10 to 20 working days. As for the long-term visa, it takes approximately  90 to 120 working days.

For the short-term South Africa visa, the applicant needs to pay BDT 3315. The long-term visa fee is between BDT 3315 to BDT 11856. The visa fee can change at times with the international dollar exchange rates. You should better check the visa fee for your visa category right before applying.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: South Africa visa Decision and the Process of Appeal
countrySections.content:
If your South Africa visa gets rejected, you can both reapply and appeal. You will get a refusal letter with the reason for your visa rejection. Study the grounds of your visa rejection and update your documents for the reapplication. This will enhance your visa approval chance.

You need to download your South Africa appeal form from the South Africa Visa Application Center, India website. Then fill it out and submit it. You are getting 2 chances to appeal against your South Africa visa. The first appeal is sent to the Director General of Home Affairs. However, the second appeal is directly sent to the Minister of Home Affairs. Applicant can appeal within 10 working days after they get their visa decision. 

The South Africa appeal decision can come out within 5 months to 2 years. You can consistently email South Africa Immigration once a week to keep the follow-up of your appeal. As for the reapplication, it will take the usual working days to process your visa.

Tunisia, officially the Republic of Tunisia, is the northernmost country in Africa. It is a part of the Maghreb region of North Africa, bordered by Algeria to the west and southwest, Libya to the southeast, and the Mediterranean Sea to the north and east

Bangladesh has a Tunisia consulate but they don’t do visa processing. To process Bangladeshis visa applications the applicant needs to submit at the embassy of Tunisia in India. To apply for Tunisia from Bangladesh, applicants or authorized representatives need to visit the Embassy of Tunisia in India. The visa approval will be identified by the visa sticker on the applicant's passport.

Please follow the article below to learn more about the Tunisia visa.
countryPage.visaTypeSectionTitle: Different Types Of Visas Available For Tunisia For Bangladeshi Citizens
countryPage.visaTypeSectionDescription: The long and short-term categories cover the purpose of the Tunisia visas pretty well. Tunisia visas can be single or multiple entry types. The short-stay visas are issued for a period not longer than 6 months with a 90 days stay permit. As for the long term, it is valid for a year with 180 days stay duration. Find the right visa for Tunisia in the list below.

visaTypeSectionContent.content:
Short-Term (Type-C)

  1. Tourism

  3. Business Visit

countryPage.title: Comoros Visa for Bangladeshi
countryPage.description:
The Union of the Comoros is a beautiful African country with lots of tropical islands. It is a diverse nation with mixed culture. 

Comoros is offering a visa-on-arrival facility for Bangladeshi citizens. The facility of an on-arrival Comoros visa for Bangladeshi is valid for short-term stays. 

Bangladesh has no Comoros consulate for visa services. For long-stay visas such as student or work visas, applicants need to contact the embassy. 

If you are a Bangladeshi citizen and want to visit Comoros, follow this article to learn more about Comoros’s authentic visa details.
countryPage.visaTypeSectionTitle: Visa Types For Bangladeshi Travelers To Comoros
countryPage.visaTypeSectionDescription: For Bangladeshi who are interested in going to Comoros with an on arrival visa, they do not need to know Comoros visa types. They only need to know the stay duration for the Comoros on-arrival visa from Bangladesh. With an on arrival Comoros visa, Bangladeshis can stay no longer than 45 days. To stay longer, applicants need to apply for a long-stay or residence visa at the nearest Comoros consulate. Here is the general list of Comoros visa types for all nations.

visaTypeSectionContent.content:
• Tourist Visa

  • Business Visa

  • Cruise Visa

  • Student Visa

  • Work Visa

  • Official Visa

countryPage.visaStepSectionTitle: Process Of Entering Comoros As A Bangladeshi
countryPage.visaStepSectionDescription: Even though you are going to get your entry pass on an on-arrival basis, you must follow a few steps to get it smoothly. There is some paperwork to do and carrying them throughout the trip is mandatory for Comoros. Here are the all steps that applicants need to follow till they enter Comoros.
countryPage.conclusion: You can see that there are no specific application processes or complex documentation works for the Comoros visa for Bangladeshi. Bangladeshis are getting an easy opportunity to visit Comoros which is an on-arrival entry pass. So, no need to think twice while planning your trip to Comoros. With a Comoros on-arrival visa for Bangladeshi, just go ahead with your plans.

items.title: Step 1: Visit the Comoros Immigration portal and download the Comoros on arrival visa form for Bangladeshi. Complete the entry pass form, print it, and bring it with you while traveling to Comoros.
Step 2: Book an airplane ticket and go to the airport on the flight date.
Step 3: Show your passport and get your entry pass seal from Bangladesh Immigration.
Step 4: Fly to Comoros’s Airport.
Step 5: Show your passport, hard copy of the application form, Air ticket, and copy of hotel booking at the Comoros airport’s entry gate.
Step 6: Also, pay approximately BDT 5850 for Comoros visa fee.
Step 7: Get your sealed entry pass and enjoy your Comoros travel.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Finland’s Visa Appeal and Its Decision
countrySections.content:
Your Finland visa will be refused if the terms and conditions of issuing a visa do not match with you. Finnish Mission has the right to refuse or revoke your visa anytime they want. A refusal letter with the grounds for the refusal reason will be provided. 

You can both appeal and reapply if your Finland visa gets rejected. It is better to reapply to stay hassle-free. Also, reapplication for the Finnish visa has a higher chance of getting approval. To reapply, update your documents. The processing time will be the same as the usual Finnish visa processing time.

You can file an appeal against a decision made by the Finnish Immigration Service to an Administrative Court. The request for the appeal must be written in Finnish or Swedish. It should be submitted within 30 days of your visa rejection. Additionally, you need to pay a processing fee of 255 euros and an Administrative Court fee of 270 euros.

countrySections.content:
The short-term Estonia visa fee is BDT 9600. You will need to pay your Estonia visa fee at the Germany Visa Application Center. Additionally, you need to pay the Visa Application Center service fee for your Estonia Schengen visas. On the contrary, the Estonia long-term visa fee for Bangladeshi is BDT 11,925. Estonia visa processing from Bangladesh for both long and short-term is 15 to 20 working days. The processing time can vary for certain cases if the application needs detailed observation.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Estonia’s Visa Appeal And Its Decision for Bangladeshi
countrySections.content:
The easiest way is to reapply if your Estonia visa application gets rejected. In this case, read the refusal letter carefully. Find out the grounds for your visa refusal and update your documents according to that. And then reapply for your Estonia visa.

If your short-term (Schengen) Estonia visa is refused, you can appeal the decision. The appeal must be filed within 30 days from the date of the visa decision. The appeal must be written in German or English language. The applicant or a third party can appeal the decision to the Administrative Court of Berlin. It will take several weeks to review the appeal. Remember, you cannot apply for a new Estonia short-term visa application until the appeal decision comes out.

You can appeal against the long-term Estonia visa refusal within 30 days of your visa rejection. You need to submit a written application to the Estonia Embassy, in India. You need to pay an amount of euros as the fee for the appeal. The appeal letter must be in Estonian language or English. The appeal can be sent personally or through a representative. The appeal decision comes within 15 days from the day you submit your appeal. If your appeal is refused, you can submit a second appeal within 30 days of the appeal refusal notification. This time you need to appeal to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs for your second appeal.

The Swedish Visa Application Center, in Bangladesh manages Belgium's short-term visa applications. The Belgium Visa Application Center in India represents long-term visa applications for Bangladeshi. countrySections.name: Time and Fees
countrySections.title: Processing Time and Fee for Belgium Visa From Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
Belgium visa processing fee for Bangladeshi is different for short and long term. The short-term Belgium visa fee is BDT 9200 along with the payment processing fee. The long-term visa fee is BDT 21,920. You also need to pay for an additional Visa Application Center service. The fee is required for short-term visa applications. 

The Schengen or short-term Belgium visa processing time is 15 to 20 working days. As for the long-term Belgium visas, the processing time usually takes 15 to 20 working days. The processing time deadline can be extended up to 30 to 60 days if your visa documentation needs a detailed examination.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Belgium Visa Decision and Appeal: Process and Details
countrySections.content:
You will get a refusal letter if your Belgium visa is rejected. In this case, you can both reapply and appeal. 

In 2024, the Belgium visa appeal process has been modified. Your appeal will be directed to the Immigration Office of the Federal Public Service Home Affairs in Brussels. The deadline for your appeal is 30 working days from the day you got your visa decision. Make sure you file your appeal in Dutch, French, or German language. Keep the hard copies of the original refusal letter, appeal letter, and any supporting documents as a backup.

You can reapply for your Belgium visa anytime you want. Update your required documents and reapply for your visa. Reapplying is considered a quicker process and more effective than appealing. In this case, you need to pay for your visa fees again.

After the appeal submission, patiently wait for the appeal decision. The duration for the Belgium appeal decision should come out within 90 days. As for the reapplication, it will take 15 to 20 days to process your visa.

countrySections.name: Time and Fees
countrySections.title: How Much Time And Fee Needed to Process a German Visa
countrySections.content:
The short-term or Schengen Germany visa fee for Bangladeshi is BDT 9600. You will need to pay your visa fee at the Germany Visa Application Center. Along with the visa fees, you need to pay the Visa Application Center service fee per application. On the contrary, the German long-term visa fee for Bangladeshi is BDT 8910. The German Embassy can change the visa fees anytime they want. Remember, the visa fees can only be paid in Bangladeshi tk and it is subject to change without notice. So, you should bring the correct amount of cash as no card transactions are possible.

Germany visa processing time for Schengen or short-term visas is 15 to 20 working days. On the contrary, long-term German visa processing takes 30 to 90 working days to process. The processing time can vary for certain cases. So, it is advised to apply in advance, but not more than six months before the intended date of the journey.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Details on Germany Visa Decision and Appeal
countrySections.content:
If your Germany visa is refused, you can appeal the decision. The appeal must be filed within 30 days from the date of the visa decision. The appeal must be written in German or English language. The applicant or a third party can appeal the decision to the Administrative Court of Berlin. Remember, you cannot apply for a new Germany short-term visa application until the appeal decision comes out. It will take several weeks to review the appeal.

You can also reapply for your Germany visa for Bangladeshi citizens anytime you want. There is no specific time frame for the reapplication. After finding out the grounds for your visa refusal, update your documents properly. It will help to increase the chances of your visa approval.

countrySections.title: Hungary Visa Decision Time and The Process of Appeal
countrySections.content:
You can appeal against Hungary's Schengen visa decision. You should appeal within 30 days of your visa refusal. Your refusal letter will mention on which basis it is refused. As for the reapplication, you can do it anytime you want. Knowing the grounds for your visa refusal, update your documents. And then, carefully apply for your Hungary visa.

countryPage.description:
Are you thinking of stepping on an Irish adventure? To ensure a smooth journey, getting an Ireland visa on time is essential. Note that, there is no Irish embassy in Bangladesh. In this case, to get an Ireland visa from Bangladesh, you need to apply for the visa to the nearest Ireland embassy in New Delhi, India. But, you can take the help of an authorized representative to apply for an Ireland visa.


Whether you are a traveler or professional, this article will help you to get A-Z ideas about applying for an Ireland visa for Bangladeshi. Besides, VISAThing can assist you with every step of your Ireland visa application in Bangladesh whenever you need to.
countryPage.visaTypeSectionTitle: Types of visas available for Ireland for Bangladeshi
countryPage.visaTypeSectionDescription: Bangladeshi citizens need visas with valid purposes to enter Ireland. The country offers both single and multiple-entry visas based on different visa purposes. The short-term Ireland visa is usually valid for 90 days, and to stay longer, you have long-term visa options. You should apply for one of the following Ireland visas depending on your travel purpose.

visaTypeSectionContent.content:
Irish Short-Stay Visas

  1. Tourist visa

  2. Business visit visa

  3. Employment visa under the Atypical Working Scheme

  4. Stage Performance or Tournament visa

  5. Training visa

  6. Short-Term Internship visa

  7. Medical treatment visa

  8. Join a Ship visa

  9. Marriage visa

  10. Exam visa

Irish Long-Term Visas

  1. Study visa

  2. Work visa

  3. Family visa

  4. Working holiday visa

  5. Researcher visa

  6. Long-Term Internship visa

  7. Volunteer visa

  8. Minister of Religion visa

  9. Retirement Visa

metaData.title: Ireland visa from Bangladesh - Fee, Time & Applying Process
metaData.description: Find out a go through process to get an Ireland visa from Bangladesh. Make your Ireland travel into reality with VISAThing.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 1: Select your visa category
countryVisaSteps.description: First, visit the online portal for Ireland visas to select the right visa category for your travel purposes. Remember, the checklist of your required documents will be changed according to the different visa categories.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 2: Fill up the visa application form online
countryVisaSteps.description: Visit the Ireland Immigration portal and carefully fill out the Ireland visa application form online. Besides, you must complete the supplementary form to get an Ireland visa from Bangladesh. Any wrong information or mistakes can make your visa application complex.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 3: Pay your visa fees
countryVisaSteps.description: After submitting your application form online, you need to pay your Ireland visa fee. You need to make an On Demand Pay at the ICICI bank in India. You can take VISAThing’s logistic service to make your payment in India.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 4: Submit your documents
countryVisaSteps.description: Prepare your required documents for submission at the Embassy of Ireland, in New Delhi, India. If your documents are not in English, translate them into English and notarize them properly. VISAThing can do this process on your behalf.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 5: Check your visa decision online
countryVisaSteps.description: After submitting your document please wait for the visa decision. The Ireland embassy will email you about their decision. You can also check your visa decision online with the reference number. The embassy decision usually gets out every Wednesday and Friday.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 6: Collect your passport
countryVisaSteps.description: When your visa decision has been made, you can collect your passport from the Embassy of the Republic of Ireland in India.

countrySections.name: Time and Fees
countrySections.title: Time and fee needed for Ireland visa processing from Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
According to the visa category of Ireland, the processing time differs. For short-term visas for Ireland, the processing time is usually 15 to 30 working days. On the other hand, long-term visas take a bit longer. The processing time for a long-term visa takes approximately 30 to 45 working days.

If you want your Ireland visa to proceed urgently due to any personal difficulties, you can email the Ministry of Justice of Ireland. Email with the subject “EMERGENCY TRAVEL REQUIRED” along with your visa application number. If you meet their criteria, their Customer Service Team will respond to your email.

Ireland visa fee from Bangladesh also varies in categories. The visa fees are different for single-entry, multiple-entry, or transit visas. The average visa fee for Ireland is between BDT 3338 to BDT 13500.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Learn about Ireland's visa decision and appeal
countrySections.content:
If your Ireland visa application gets rejected, you can both reapply or appeal. Reapplication is considered the most effective method for any type of visa refusal. You need to look for the grounds of your Ireland visa refusal from the refusal letter. Once you find out the reason, update your documents. And then reapply with a positive expectation anytime you want.

For the appeal, one appeal for one application is the system of Ireland. If you appeal once against your visa decision, you cannot appeal anymore. You also need to apply for an appeal within 2 months of your Ireland visa refusal. Your refusal letter will state the reason behind your visa refusal and include your eligibility to appeal. Remember to provide additional documents if needed with the appeal letter. Appeals must be sent by mail to Ireland's Embassy in New Delhi. 

In some cases, you cannot appeal or may be blocked for up to 5 years. This usually happens If you provide misleading or false information in your original Ireland visa application.

The reapplication takes the usual visa processing time of Ireland visa approval. The decision time for an Ireland visa appeal fully depends on the Immigration or Department of Justice. You can get your appeal decision within 30 days to 2 years.

countryPage.title: Netherlands visa from Bangladesh
countryPage.description:
Bangladeshi citizens need a visa sticker on their passport for the Netherlands. They must apply in person for this. If you're planning to get a Netherlands visa from Bangladesh, be careful.


Bangladesh has a Royal Netherlands Embassy in Dhaka. Yet, it doesn't directly process applications for Bangladeshi people. Instead, the Sweden Visa Application Center, in Bangladesh, handles short-term visas. For long-stay visas, the Netherlands Embassy of Bangladesh is the right place. Check out the article for more visa details.
countryPage.visaTypeSectionTitle: Available visa types for Netherlands from Bangladesh
countryPage.visaTypeSectionDescription: The applicant’s visa purpose can specify the number of days that they can stay with their visa. The Netherlands short-stay visa allows applicants to stay there for not more than 90 days. However, the Netherland's long-term multiple-entry visas permit Bangladeshis to stay for up to 5 years. Well, here is the list of the Netherlands visa types for Bangladeshis.

visaTypeSectionContent.content:
Short-Term Visas (Type-C)

  2. Business Visit

  3. Visit Family or Friend

  4. Official Visit

Transit Visa (Type-A)

  • Seamen Transit Visa

Long-Term Visas (Type-D)

  2. Work

  3. Join Family

  4. Au Pair

  5. Working Holiday

  6. Self-employed and Startup

metaData.title: Netherlands visa from Bangladesh - Application Process
metaData.description: Secure Netherlands visa from Bangladesh through VISAThing. Learn A to Z about the Netherlands visa application process.

countryVisaSteps.title: Short-Term Visa Application
countryVisaSteps.description: The short-term Netherlands visa application process is straightforward. It can be applied through the Swedish Visa Application Center. The Swedish Visa Application Center, Bangladesh accepts Bangladeshis Netherlands visa applications. Here is the process in case you want to apply.

items.title: Step 1: Visit the Sweden Visa Application Center in Bangladesh website.
Step 2: Choose your Netherlands's visa category.
Step 3: Download the online Netherlands visa application form and fill it up.
Step 4: Gather required documents, translate them into English, and notarize them.
Step 5: Download the payment form and collect it with the required documents. Your visa payment will be made at the time of your appointment.
Step 6: Submit the documents and provide biometrics at the Sweden Visa Application Center in person.
Step 7: Pay your Netherlands visa fee in cash at the NRB bank booth in the Sweden Visa Application Centre, Dhaka.
Step 8: Collect your passport when the visa decision comes out.

countryVisaSteps.title: Long-Term Visa Application
countryVisaSteps.description: You should apply for a long-stay visa if you want a visa for more than 90 days. The Netherlands Embassy of Bangladesh is responsible for processing Netherlands MVV visas. The process is mentioned below.

items.title: Step 1: Collect your Netherlands Residence permit and necessary documents.
Step 2: Book an appointment by emailing the Netherlands Embassy in Bangladesh.
Step 3: Visit the Embassy in person on the appointment day.
Step 4: Submit your documents and Biometrics.
Step 5: Pay your Netherlands visa fee at the embassy on the same day.
Step 6: Collect your passport after the visa decision.

countryFaqs.statement: How long does it take to process a Netherlands visa from Bangladesh?
countryFaqs.answer: The short-term Netherlands visa takes 15 to 20 working days to process. And, the long-term visa takes 10 to 15 working days.

countryFaqs.statement: How much does a visa cost for the Netherlands from Bangladesh?
countryFaqs.answer: For the long and short-term, Netherlands visa costs between BDT 9200 to 14470.

countrySections.name: Time and Fees
countrySections.title: Processing time and Netherlands visa fee from Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
Netherlands visa processing fee for Bangladeshi is different for short and long term. The short-term Netherlands visa fee is BDT 9200 along with the payment processing fee. 

The long-term Netherlands visa fee is BDT 14470. You also need to pay for an additional Visa Application Center service. The fee is required for both short-term visa applications. 

The Schengen or short-term Netherlands visa processing time is 15 to 20 working days. As for the long-term Netherlands visas, the processing time usually takes 10 to 15 working days.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: Learn About Netherlands Visa Decision and Appeal
countrySections.content:
Bangladeshi applicants can appeal against the decision to the Netherlands Immigration. An authorized person is also allowed to appeal on the applicant's behalf. The review of the appeal usually takes 12 weeks to make their decision.

If the IND rejects your appeal, you can still apply for a judicial review.

Applicants can also reapply for their Netherlands visa. The written form of the refusal letter contains the reason for the visa refusal. After finding out the ground, applicants should update their documents before reapplying.
